author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2014
review_content: It's just OK and I'm glad I didn't pay anything for it. I get tired of having to go over the same scenes time after time. Even after you've cleared a level you start back at the beginning. So, when you've gone, say 1000m, and you kill the driver, you have to go back to the beginning, no matter what level you are on.I also cannot see that upgrading makes any changes except to the engine. Suspension, tires, AWD, nothing is changed as you upgrade. Further, there is no variability of the brakes or gas; it's either full-on or full-off.Finally, there is NO explanation or instruction. The player is just left to figure it out for themselves.  I'm not taken by this game and only play it when I tire of the other stuff I've been doing.

author: MLB1970
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2014
review_content: This is one of those games that provides a chance for you to forget about the stresses of life for a few minutes (or hours, depending on how addicted you become).  You choose a vehicle, you choose a "track", and away you go, trying to drive as far as you can, maneuvering over and through various obstacles.  I particularly like driving in the moon track with a powerful vehicle, doing tons of flips in the zero gravity environment.  It's fun to unlock new vehicles and tracks, and to upgrade each vehicle for better speed and handling is satisfying.  My only wish for this game is that the upgrading could happen a little faster.  Otherwise, I recommend this game.
title: Fun Game that is easy to play
